1.text: But Eliphaz the Themanite, answering, said:

2.text: If we start to speak to you, perhaps you will take it badly, but who can hold back the words he has conceived?

3.text: Behold, you have taught many, and you have strengthened weary hands.

4.text: Your words have reassured the wavering, and you have fortified the trembling knees.

5.text: But now the scourge has overcome you, and you falter. It has touched you, and you are disturbed.

6.text: Where is your reverence, your fortitude, your patience, and the perfection of your ways?

7.text: Consider this, I beg you: who ever perished being innocent? Or when have the righteous been destroyed?

8.text: In fact, I have instead seen those who work iniquity and who sow resentments, reap them,

9.text: perishing by the breath of God, and being consumed by the wrath of his spirit.

10.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the lioness, and the teeth of young lions have been worn away.

11.text: The tiger has perished because it does not have prey, and the young lions have been scattered.

12.text: Furthermore, a word was spoken to me in secret, and, as if by theft, my ears received the pulse of its whisper.

13.text: In the horror of a vision by night, when men are accustomed to be overtaken by a deep sleep,

14.text: fear and trembling seized me and all my bones were terrified.

15.text: And when a spirit passed before me, the hair on my body stood up.

16.text: There appeared an image before my eyes, someone whose face I did not recognize, and I heard a voice like a gentle breeze.

17.text: Should man be justified in relation to God, or will a man be more pure than his Maker?

18.text: Behold, those who serve him are not steadfast, and in his angels he finds imperfection.

19.text: How much more will those who live in houses of clay, which have an earthly foundation, be consumed like the moth?

20.text: From morning all the way to evening, they will be cut down, and because no one understands, they will be destroyed without ceasing.

21.text: But those who are left behind will be taken away from them; they will die, and not in wisdom.
